answers.answer: MFM is grest! They will take good care of you. I've been on bed rest since I've been 20 weeks. They have been monitoring me since on a weekly basis. Just think positive!

My OB told me that everything is not fine and the MFM doctor was probably just trying to comfort me aimce there isn't too much to be done...baby is now less than 5% and my blood pressure is fluctuating. She is pretty sure I have preeclampsia and now I am on bed rest :-\ at 27wks.

There is hope! My baby was under the 5th percentile, and I was put on bed rest at 24 weeks. Also had weekly checks. My baby had gastroschisis so being small was expected, but that was too small. Anyway, he was born at 38 weeks weighing in at 8lbs! :) good luck!
That is great to hear! Thanks!

I know a lady who delivered her baby at 27 weeks because she had HELP which is the worst stage of preeclampsia and because she was in such a good hospital the baby lived. Do exactly what they say and try not to stress about it. I know easier said than done but your dr is looking out for you

I am going to do my very best to listen! I feel bad because my fiance works 12-16 hour days and will now have to come home and do the chores the kids are too small to do, and all of my family is 7+ hours away. But he told me to let him worry about that and not to go crazy buying books online. He is also trying to talk me into summer daycare for the kids since school is out in two weeks...

Always think positive. They didn't think my baby was going to survive at 20 weeks. I had to have 2 stitches put into my cervix because it was opening. If it wasn't for the surgery and having the stitches put in, I would only have .5 cm let of my cervix left. The doctors will do everything in their power to help you and your baby. Much sure you rest and do everything the doctors tell you

question: Mfm has increased my monitoring from every three weeks to every week because baby dropped from 24% to 8% on growth and today is still measuring 2 weeks behind. They do not see anything wrong and I have no pregnancy related medical issues. The Mfm doctor told me he isn't worried but then said he is recommending bed rest to my OB and I am now coming in for weekly monitoring. I am confused on how to feel but am glad I see my OB in an hour!
title: Undecided
